snippet: The United Nations’ top human rights official on Tuesday called on the Security Council to back efforts to overturn the extremist group’s “ideology of violence.”
abstract: Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein, United Nations high commissioner for human rights, calls on Muslims to denounce crimes of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; Al Hussein, first Muslim to be named to the post, says militants' actions have been in violation of both international law and Islamic tenets.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ top human rights official on Tuesday called on the Security Council to back efforts to overturn the extremist group’s “ideology of violence.”

headline.main: U.N. Urges Arab World to Denounce Islamic State
headline.print_headline: U.N. Rights Offical Calls on Muslims to Denounce ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
